references.paper_title: Video generation models as world simulators
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of using video generation models as world simulators, a key idea in the context of egocentric video generation and world simulation.

references.paper_title: Ego4D: Around the world in 3,000 hours of egocentric video
references.reason: Ego4D is a large-scale egocentric video dataset that is foundational to the creation of EgoVid-5M, providing the base data that is refined and expanded upon in the current work.

references.paper_title: Stable video diffusion: Scaling latent video diffusion models to large datasets
references.reason: This paper addresses the challenge of scaling video diffusion models to large datasets, a crucial aspect in training high-quality egocentric video generation models.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: CLIP, introduced in this paper, is a critical component of the EgoVid-5M annotation pipeline used for assessing semantic consistency between videos and textual descriptions.

references.paper_title: On the content bias in Fréchet video distance
references.reason: This paper introduces CD-FVD, a metric used to evaluate the quality of generated videos in EgoVid-5M, addressing limitations of existing video quality metrics.
